disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: When harboring frustration towards members within, did I intentionally create divisions that undermine the unity of the Church?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I reject Church unity when frustrated with parishioners, confusing their human imperfections with Christ's divine nature?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I use my words to intentionally belittle or demean the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I use words that belittled or scorned the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Have I shown disrespect to my mother through my actions and attitudes?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

condoning.question: Did I, through my words, encourage fellow Catholics to neglect receiving sacraments or attending Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Have I, by my words, encouraged others to stay away from Sacraments or Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I permit adults who are under my influence to be exposed to bad influences?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval, through words, to another Catholic's decision to marry outside of the Church, thereby condoning their choice?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic who was planning to remarry outside of the Church, thereby potentially scandalizing others?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

adultery.question: Did I forgo a valid Catholic marriage, thereby committing adultery through my deeds?
adultery.description: For Catholics, marriage is sacramental and needs to occur in the Church or receive a dispensation if either people are not Catholic.

uncharity.question: Do I turn away from those who are in need, including strangers and displaced persons?

uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience with others when we didn't see things from the same perspective?

extracted_data_phrases: in a group or community setting

uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Have I failed to provide assistance to those who could have used my help?
uncharity.description: Refusing to help those in need violates Jesus's direct command to love our neighbor and practice the works of mercy, as illustrated in the parable of the Good Samaritan.

uncharity.question: Have I shown compassion and practical assistance to those in need, particularly through volunteering, sharing my time and resources with others, or participating in community activities?

merciless.question: Have I judged others harshly through my words?
merciless.description: Condemning others is a sin of mercilessness because it places oneself in God's role as judge and denies others the same mercy and forgiveness that God extends to all of us.

vainglory.question: Did I give alms to be seen by others, rather than for God's glory?

sloth.question: Did I neglect to spend quality time in prayer each day, allowing God's presence and guidance to be absent from my daily routine?

blasphemy.question: Have I entertained feelings towards someone else's spouse that were not motivated by charity, respect, and good intentions?
blasphemy.description: This sin undermines the sacred bond of marriage by treating another person as an object of desire rather than respecting their dignity and commitment to their spouse.

blasphemy.question: Have I, in my conversations and discussions, used the name of God as a byword or curse?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: of God , Jesus , or Our Lord
as a byword or curse in your conversation
blasphemy.question: Did you use the sacred name of God, Jesus, or Our Lord as a byword or curse in your conversation?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

blasphemy.question: Did I speak Jesus' name or God's holy name in jest, ridicule, or disrespect?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I lead, guide, or advise others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: with others in community settings or through volunteering
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I interact with others in community settings or through volunteering?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: of leisure activities , volunteering , and community involvement
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of leisure activities, volunteering, and community involvement become an excuse to assert my dominance or control over others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: including wealth and goods accumulated over time , a driving force in my life
greed.question: Did I make my material possessions, including wealth and goods accumulated over time, a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: to an excessive focus on material security
greed.question: Did I make acquiring wealth and possessions a driving force in my life, leading to an excessive focus on material security?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Did I show unjust favoritism, prejudice, or cruel treatment towards others through my words and actions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeing them as full individuals created in God 's image
as full individuals created in God 's image
lust.question: Have I reduced others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them as full individuals created in God's image?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

rather than seeing their inherent dignity and value
lust.question: Did I view others primarily through what they could do for me, rather than seeing their inherent dignity and value?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: perhaps through conversation , gestures , or images that stir lust
lust.question: Have I had actual or simulated sexual acts outside of marriage, perhaps through conversation, gestures, or images that stir lust?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

lust.question: Have I committed acts of lust outside of marriage, even in thought or desire?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: as the source of my blessings and comforts
autonomy.question: Have I grown complacent in my retirement, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence as the source of my blessings and comforts?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: such as taking online courses or maintaining social connections , solely to my own abilities without acknowledging God 's providence
autonomy.question: Did I attribute my accomplishments in retirement, such as taking online courses or maintaining social connections, solely to my own abilities without acknowledging God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did you harbor doubts about God's existence?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

autonomy.question: Did I entertain doubts about God's existence through my thoughts, perhaps while reflecting on life's uncertainties or questioning faith's relevance in modern times?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

autonomy.question: Have I failed to acknowledge my complete dependence on God's grace, instead relying solely on my own abilities?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

extracted_data_phrases: in even the most mundane aspects of my daily life
autonomy.question: Did I trust solely in my own abilities, neglecting the need for God's grace in even the most mundane aspects of my daily life?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Have I, in my daily habits and preferences, overindulged in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: to my physical or spiritual well - being
gluttony.question: Did I fail to regulate my food intake, allowing excessive eating or drinking that was detrimental to my physical or spiritual well-being?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over essential financial commitments for myself , such as long - term care or securing my fixed income

prodigality.question: Have I recklessly prioritized entertainment expenses over essential financial commitments for myself, such as long-term care or securing my fixed income?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over my responsible management of resources
prodigality.question: Have I permitted excessive and wasteful financial risks to take precedence over my responsible management of resources, potentially compromising my ability to provide for my needs and those I am responsible for?

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what was shared was true, during my social gatherings or conversations?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking about others ' personal struggles or weaknesses
about others ' personal struggles or weaknesses
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking about others' personal struggles or weaknesses, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in unnecessary activities on Sundays , when they could have been avoided without offending God
on Sundays , when they could have been avoided without offending God
impiety.question: Did I engage in unnecessary activities on Sundays, when they could have been avoided without offending God?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impurity.question: Did I intentionally use certain practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that is immodest and unbecoming to my dignity

impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

infidelity.question: Did you commit any deeds that could be considered breaking your marriage vows?
infidelity.description: Fidelity in marriage is viewed as a sacred covenant made before God - not just a contract between people, thus breaking vows is seen as a betrayal of both divine and human trust.

violence.question: Have I intentionally caused pain or suffering to someone through my actions?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

extracted_data_phrases: with what God has provided for me
envy.question: Have I let envy inspire me to covet others' possessions, leading me to be discontent with what God has provided for me?
envy.description: This sin stems from ingratitude for one's own blessings and letting material desires control our hearts.

extracted_data_phrases: such as homes or material goods
envy.question: Have I given in to envy when seeing others' possessions, such as homes or material goods?
envy.description: This sin stems from ingratitude for one's own blessings and letting material desires control our hearts.

extracted_data_phrases: with mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards
sorcery.question: Have you interacted with mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: from mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards
sorcery.question: Have you used your words to seek guidance from mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change your spiritual routine or practices that have been recommended by your priests or spiritual directors
presumption.question: Have you deliberately persisted in sinful behavior, counting on God's mercy without making any effort to change your spiritual routine or practices that have been recommended by your priests or spiritual directors?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change your ways
presumption.question: Have you deliberately persisted in sinful behavior, trusting in God's mercy without making any effort to change your ways?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change your ways or grow spiritually
presumption.question: Did you deliberately persist in sinful behavior, taking God's mercy for granted without making any effort to change your ways or grow spiritually?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.question: Did you procrastinate confessing your sins to a priest, putting off repentance for an unknown period?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.
